snippet: European leaders crisscrossed the Continent to discuss strategies for handling the debt crisis, a day after the central bank president described plans to buy short-term government bonds.
abstract: European leaders meet to discuss strategies for handling the sovereign debt crisis, a day after the central bank president Mario Draghi makes clear plans to buy short-term government bonds, seeming to set the stage for a policy announcement.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels and Melissa Eddy from Berlin. Landon Thomas Jr. contributed reporting from London and Gaia Pianigiani from Rome.

lead_paragraph: European leaders crisscrossed the Continent to discuss strategies for handling the debt crisis, a day after the central bank president described plans to buy short-term government bonds.

headline.print_headline: Europe’s Leaders Step Up Talks Before Policy Meeting
